clean_content:
Definition / general

* Benign expansion of immature terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase (TdT) positive T cells in extramedullary and extrathymic tissues* Can be seen concurrently with other hematologic disorders or epithelial malignancies, such as Castleman disease, follicular dendritic cell sarcomas, angioimmunoblastic T cell lymphoma, hepatocellular carcinoma, acinic cell carcinoma, etc.

Essential features

* Benign proliferation of extrathymic immature T cells that lack significant morphologic atypia but mimic malignant T lymphoblastic lymphoma / leukemia* Nonclonal process without evidence of TCR γ or β gene rearrangements* Lack of aberrant immunophenotypic or karyotypic abnormalities

Terminology

* Immature T lymphoblastic proliferation* iT-LBP

Epidemiology

* Age, gender, ethnicity, incidence / prevalence are undefined at this point

Sites

* Typically presents with localized lymphadenopathy or a discrete mass* Common anatomical locations: mandible, cervical, supraclavicular, abdominal, retroperitoneal and oropharyngeal regions ([Adv Anat Pathol 2013;20:137](23574769))* Rare cases have shown disseminated multinodal involvement ([Am J Surg Pathol 2014;38:1298](24618611))* Does not involve mediastinum* Peripheral blood and bone marrow are not involved

Clinical features

* Clinical presentation varies but patients are generally asymptomatic and healthy* Can be associated with other underlying neoplastic pathologic conditions, such as carcinomas, Castleman disease, follicular dendritic cell tumors and angioimmunoblastic T cell lymphoma ([Am J Surg Pathol 2012;36:1619](23060347))

Diagnosis

* Major criteria ([Adv Anat Pathol 2013;20:137](23574769)):
  + No aberrant antigen expression (immunophenotype is of normal immature cortical thymocytes)+ Nonclonal TdT+ T cells+ No evidence of T cell gene rearrangements (TCR α and TCR β)+ Clinical evidence of indolence, > 6 months of follow up without progression in the absence of treatment

Prognostic factors

* Clinically indolent* May persist in the involved tissue

Case reports

* 35 year old man with indolent T lymphoblastic proliferation associated with low grade follicular dendritic cell sarcoma and Castleman disease ([Pathology 2018;50:351](29486963))* 37 year old woman with an indolent T lymphoblastic proliferation involving the upper aerodigestive tract ([Int J Clin Exp Pathol 2014;7:6350](25337290))* 41 year old woman with pelvic pain found to have localized Castleman disease with concomitant iT-LBP ([Ann Pathol 2019;39:29](30554835))

Treatment

* Typical lesions show no signs of progression and require no treatment* Treatment for secondary disease (if present) may be needed

Gross description

* Typically forms a tumor mass, varies in size from ≤ 1 cm to ≥ 9 cm in greatest dimension* External surface may be firm and fibrous or nonencapsulated* Displays pink-tan firm fleshy cut surfaces* Necrotic (yellow) areas may be seen in cases associated with hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC)* Reference: [Adv Anat Pathol 2013;20:137](23574769)

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Preservation of overall tissue architecture ([Adv Anat Pathol 2013;20:137](23574769))* Lymph nodes: benign lymphoblasts localize predominantly to interfollicular / paracortical regions* Carcinomas: lymphoblasts are interspersed or clustered between malignant epithelial cells without definitive evidence of lymphoepithelial lesions* Small to intermediate sized lymphoid cells with immature fine / blastoid chromatin lacking significant atypia* Inconspicuous nucleoli* Numerous mitotic figures may be present* Histiocytes are interspersed evenly throughout the proliferation

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by Kunwar Singh, M.D. and Robert S. Ohgami, M.D., Ph.D.  

[![Castleman disease](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodestlymphoblasticMicroSingh1.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodestlymphoblasticMicroSingh1.jpg)

Castleman disease

[![Follicular dendritic cell tumor](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodestlymphoblasticMicroSingh2.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodestlymphoblasticMicroSingh2.jpg)

Follicular dendritic cell tumor

[![CD1a](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodestlymphoblasticMicroSingh3.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodestlymphoblasticMicroSingh3.jpg)

CD1a

[![CD3](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodestlymphoblasticMicroSingh4.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodestlymphoblasticMicroSingh4.jpg)

CD3

  

[![CD4](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodestlymphoblasticMicroSingh5.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodestlymphoblasticMicroSingh5.jpg)

CD4

[![CD8](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodestlymphoblasticMicroSingh6.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodestlymphoblasticMicroSingh6.jpg)

CD8

[![CD99](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodestlymphoblasticMicroSingh7.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodestlymphoblasticMicroSingh7.jpg)

CD99

[![TdT](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodestlymphoblasticMicroSingh8.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/lymphnodestlymphoblasticMicroSingh8.jpg)

TdT

Cytology description

* Small to intermediate sized monotonous population with fine dispersed chromatin pattern and scant cytoplasm; occasional variably sized nucleoli may be present

Positive stains

* Positive: [TdT](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainstdt.html), [CD3](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd3.html), [CD43](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd43.html), [CD45RO](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd40.html#cd45ro286750)* Variable: [CD10](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd10.html), [CD99](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd99.html), [CD1a](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd1a.html), [CD2](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd1.html#cd2288039), [CD5](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd5.html), [CD7](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd1.html#cd7288045), [CD4](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd4.html)+ / [CD8](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd8.html)+ or [CD4](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd4.html)- / [CD8](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd8.html)-* High [Ki67](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainski67.html) index

Negative stains

* [PAX5](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainspax5.html), [CD20](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd20.html), [CD79a](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd79a.html), [CD30](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd30.html)* No thymic epithelium seen by immunostains

Flow cytometry description

* Incidental benign [TdT](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainstdt.html)+ T cell populations may be detected by flow cytometry* Immunophenotype can show the entire range of T cell differentiation from the most immature dual [CD4](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd4.html)- / [CD8](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd8.html)- / [CD7](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd1.html#cd7288045) bright+ / [CD34](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd34.html)+ / cytoplasmic [CD3](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd3.html)+ / surface [CD3](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd3.html)- forms to surface [CD3](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd3.html)+ forms with coexpression of [CD4](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd4.html) and [CD8](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd8.html) ([Cytometry B Clin Cytom 2020;98:282](31571375))* Proportion of T lymphoblasts (identified by cytoplasmic [CD3](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd3.html) and [TdT](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainstdt.html) expression) can vary from < 1% of events to > 50% of events

Molecular / cytogenetics description

* iT-LBP have nonclonal T cell receptor (TCR) gene rearrangement studies (TCR γ or β)* No definitive chromosomal abnormalities* Initial reported case reported chromosome 9 inversion of uncertain significance ([Am J Surg Pathol 1999;23:977](10435569))

Sample pathology report

* Lymph node, inguinal, excision:
  + Castleman disease, hyaline vascular variant+ Indolent T lymphoblastic proliferation (see comment)+ Comment: Sections from the inguinal node show predominantly preserved nodal architecture with atretic follicles and increased vascularity with a subset of hyalinized vessels penetrating regressed germinal centers. Interspersed within the paracortical areas are increased CD3+ / TdT+ positive T cells without aberrant antigen expression. The presence of immature T cells in association with hyaline vascular Castleman disease has been reported and typically shows indolent behavior. Clinical correlation is recommended. ([Am J Surg Pathol 2012;36:1619](23060347))

Differential diagnosis

* [T lymphoblastic leukemia / lymphoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/leukemiaTall.html):
  + Typically effaces nodal architecture or will infiltrate relatively nondiscriminately throughout entire node obliterating residual follicles+ Usually expresses [LMO2](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainslmo2.html) on malignant lymphoblasts ([Histopathology 2020;77:984](32526041))* [Ectopic thymic tissue](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/thyroidthymictissue.html):
    + Residual thymic epithelium is also present and is highlighted by keratin stains: [AE1 / AE3](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsae1ae3.html), [CAM5.2](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainscam52.html), [CK7](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck7.html)* [Thymoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mediastinumthymoma.html):
      + Lobulated architecture+ Presence of thymic epithelial meshworks+ No expression of [LMO2](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainslmo2.html) on lymphoblasts+ Presence in the mediastinum

Additional references

* [Am J Surg Pathol 2018;42:1647](30222603)
